topic.title: Export Data as CSV Dialog Box

para.text: Export Data as CSV Dialog Box
This dialog box is used to export data set values along with their locations to a comma-separated value (CSV) file. Many programs can read such files. To display the dialog box, select

The top part of the dialog box has a tree control in which the data sets are listed. Check the check boxes for any data sets for which you wish to export values. Below the tree control are two sets of radio buttons. They control which data sets are displayed in the tree control. One of the sets of radio buttons is only active for PHAST models.
In addition to data set values, the

can include the X, Y, and (for 3D data sets) Z coordinates as well as the column, row, and (for 3D data sets) layer numbers. For SUTRA models, the column, row, and layer are replaced by the node or element number. In Models with grids instead of meshes, X_Prime and Y_Prime are also saved following the Y or Z coordinate.
button to save the data values and associated information.
